intro: Agelanthus rondensis, commonly known as the Rondôniense tree, is a tropical evergreen species native to the Amazon rainforest. It is characterized by its large, glossy, dark green leaves that are typically alternate and elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by reddish-brown fruits containing a single seed. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and terra firme forests. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it plays a role in the ecological diversity of the region.
